description: A five-slide presentation with key information about Baseball.
title: All About Baseball

slides.title: Introduction to Baseball
slides.content: Baseball is a bat-and-ball sport played between two teams of nine players each, taking turns batting and fielding. The game is played on a diamond-shaped field with four bases. The objective is to score runs by hitting a thrown ball and running around the bases, while the fielding team tries to prevent runs and get batters out.

slides.title: History and Origins
content: Baseball evolved from older bat-and-ball games like rounders and cricket in England, with the first recorded game in North America in 1791.
Alexander Cartwright formalized the modern rules in 1845, establishing the diamond-shaped field and 90-foot base paths.
The National League was founded in 1876, followed by the American League in 1901, leading to the World Series.
Jackie Robinson broke the color barrier in 1947 when he joined the Brooklyn Dodgers, becoming the first African American in MLB.

slides.title: Rules and Gameplay
content: A standard game consists of 9 innings, with each team getting a turn to bat (offense) and field (defense).
The pitcher throws the ball toward home plate, and the batter tries to hit it into fair territory.
Players advance by running counterclockwise around the four bases: first, second, third, and home plate.
The fielding team can get batters out by striking them out (3 strikes), catching fly balls, or tagging runners or bases.

slides.title: Famous Players and Records
content: Babe Ruth hit 714 home runs and revolutionized the game with his power hitting in the early 20th century.
Hank Aaron holds the record for most career home runs with 755, breaking Babe Ruth's record in 1974.
Cy Young won 511 games, the most in MLB history, and the Cy Young Award for pitching excellence is named after him.
Nolan Ryan threw a record 7 no-hitters and holds the record for most strikeouts with 5,714 in his career.

slides.title: Global Impact and Leagues
content: Major League Baseball (MLB) is the highest level of professional baseball, with 30 teams across the United States and Canada.
The World Series is the championship series of MLB, played annually between the American and National League champions.
Baseball has spread globally with professional leagues in Japan, South Korea, Taiwan, and several Latin American countries.
The World Baseball Classic is an international tournament featuring national teams from around the world.
